title: arun khetarpal movie:Varun Dhawan To Play Arun Khetarpal, 21-Year Old Officer Who Single-Handedly Defeated 7 Pak Tanks in 1971
text:
One of the bravest officers of Indian Army and also the youngest Param Vir Chakra Recipient, Arun Khetarpal’s story will soon be told to the audiences via a biographical movie.

The man who is known for his extra-ordinary service is one of the most influential people in the Indian army. The 21-year-old braveheart single-handedly defeated seven Pakistani tanks before losing his life in the Battle of Basantar during the Indo-Pakistan War of 1971.

Twitter

Filmmaker Sriram Raghavan, who is known for films including Andhadhun and Badlapur, will be directing it. Ritesh Shah of Pink fame will be scripting the biopic. It is said that the makers have approached Varun Dhawan to play the lead role in the movie, which is said to be titled Ekkis.

TOI

Varun has now confirmed the news, and he says he is excited to play the role. "Playing a soldier has always been my dream. After I heard Arun Khetrapals story I was honestly shocked that this could actually happen! I understood why Dinoo and Sriram were so passionate about it. And after I met Aruns brother Mukesh Khetarpal I was moved, I too have a brother and I can't fathom what he must have gone through," he told Mumbai Mirror.

He added that he thinks it is the most important film of his career.

Director Raghavan was a kid when the war had took place. However, he remembers putting black paper on the windows during the war. "So when Dinoo (producer Dinesh Vijan) asked me to make a film around the subject, I found it daunting initially. Movies set in wartime have always moved me, forced me to reconsider. This is a solid story told over two generations of soldiers," he said.

Arun Khetarpal is one of the most respected personalities in Indian Army. Do you think Varun Dhawan is an apt choice for the role?
